result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brandon B Roller in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1, Ct. 6, and Ct. 7 in 15 CF 121 Judgment to be entered, Ct. 2, 3, 4 and 5 in 15 CF 121 dismissed and read in, 14 CF 346 dismissed, read in, Defendant's mother J.Q. makes statement, defendant makes statement, Ct. 1, Court withholds sentence, probation 3 years, $518.00 costs, Defendant to provide DNA Sample, firearms restriction, Ct. 6. Court withholds sentence, probation 1 year, concurrent, $243.00 costs, 3 months jail w/Huber, concurrent to Ct. 7,  Jail start date 10/6/15 at 7:00 P.M., Ct. 7, Court withholds sentence, probation 1 year, concurrent, $243.00 costs, 3 months jail w/Huber, concurrent to Ct. 6, defendant to report to probation and parole tomorrow 9/22/15

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Request for substitution of Judge filed by Atty Riek.

Defendant Brandon B Roller in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request for substitution of judge filed by Atty Riek.  Court found request was filed in a timely manner.  Defendant plead not guilty. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.  Trial will be set after judge is assigned.
Oct. 23, 2014 preliminary hearing  filed by Court Reporter Cathy Braunschweig
filed by Atty Yaskal

Defendant Brandon B Roller in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State calls Deputy Matthew Menard, Columbia County Sheriff's Office, testimony taken, Court finds probable cause found in Ct. 1 and Ct. 2, bound over for further proceedings, Court does not find probable cause on Ct. 3,  bond cont'd  Arraignment scheduled for December 16, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
filed by ADA Brenda Yaskal
